YourBest Of Vietnam In 14 Daystour begins in Hanoi, where rich history, culture, and stunning landscapes await. Upon arrival at Noi Bai International Airport, a private driver will greet you and transfer you to your hotel in the heart of Hanoi. After checking in and settling down, take some time to rest and recover from your journey. Once you're refreshed, feel free to explore Hanoi at your own pace. Wander through the vibrant streets, visit historic sites, and immerse yourself in the lively atmosphere of the city, where traditional architecture blends seamlessly with modern charm.

Your Vietnam adventure begins with your arrival in Hanoi. Your private driver will meet you at the airport, holding a signboard with your name. He will escort you to your accommodation right in the heart of the city, with the fascinating Old Quarter at your fingertips. You can easily explore the city at your own pace or relax at the hotel after the flight.

You’ll be picked up by our friendly guide and depart for Ninh Binh province. Along the way, take a short break to relax before heading to Hoa Lu, the ancient capital of Vietnam from 968 to 1010. Here, you’ll learn about the Vietnamese feudal system under the Dinh, Le, and Ly dynasties. Afterward, enjoy a cycling tour around the village to explore the local way of life. Next, you’ll have a buffet lunch at the Ninh Binh Excursion Restaurant, a 5-star establishment offering a variety of local dishes such as goat meat, spring rolls, fish, chicken, fried rice, and vegetable salad, with vegetarian options available.

Have an early breakfast at the hotel and complete the check-out formalities. Take the limousine bus to get toSapa, the travel time will take around 6 hours. Upon arrival to Sapa, you will be transferred to your accommodation. The rest of the day is free to explore this charming town right in the middle of the mountains.

Have breakfast at the hotel. Meet your guide around 9:30 am and start your 12 km trekking. You will visitY Linh HoandLao Chaivillages of the Hmong minorities. On the way admire the breathtaking landscapes ofrice terracesand mountains. Have lunch in Lao Chai village nearby the river. Continue your hike toTa Vanvillage of the Dzay people. Here you will stay overnight and have the opportunity to experience the daily life and original customs of local people.

Once you get energy for your last day trek by having a delicious breakfast, you leave forGiang Ta Chaivillage of the Red Dao minority. You will trek through abamboo forest, which belongs to Hoang Lien National Park. On the way, you will pass by awaterfalland rattan bridge, where you will have time to take a rest and enjoy the surroundings. You will find a nice place to enjoy lunch.

Have breakfast. Our cruise will pick you up from your hotel. Take the most scenic route to reachHalong Bay, taking you across the Red River Delta with emerald green rice paddies stretching for as far as the eyes can see. On arrival at Halong, you get toenjoy a cruise on the Bay to explore the limestone rocks and the karst grottoes.

Rise early fora lesson in Tai Chi or just to enjoy a hearty breakfast. The boat will make its way back to the port stopping at the Limestone Cave, full of stalagmites and stalactites. From here, it’s clear sailing back to the main harbor and the return to Hanoi around 17:00. Free in your leisure time.
Have breakfast at the hotel, have some free leisure time until there will be a private cab to transfer you to the airport, and get ready for the next flight to Hoi An.

Custom tailoring is a huge industry inHoi An. Hoi An is home to more than 400 tailoring shops and thousands of tailors who are not only talented at making clothes but are skilled in making shoes and handbags as well! The average turnaround time for full suits is a day and about 4 hours for handbags or shoes! If you are interested in getting custom-made items, try to find a shop of your liking as early as possible during your visit.

Today you will have free time to explore Hoi An at your own pace, seeing what interests you. This ancient town isfull of Japanese merchant houses and pagodas, temples, and antique warehouses.Or just lounge about in a laid-back riverside café on the bank of the Thu Bon River.
Breakfast at the hotel. Then, taking the flight to Ho Chi Minh City. Check-in your hotel and free at your leisure time to get your energy back.
(Start 7:20 am  – return around 17.30)

The Independence Palace is a widely known landmark of Ho Chi Minh City and was designed by the architect Ngo Viet Thu. Continue seeing the beautiful structures from theFrench Colonialtimes such as theNotre Dame Cathedral, the historicCentral Post Office. Followed by the remarkable site of the War Remnants Museum the museum has a vast display of the both the Indochina wars.

itinerary_desc: Our English - speaking guide will meet you at the hotel around 8:00 am and take you for a cycle trip to the countryside and rivers around Hoi An.As you meander through the countryside, you will experience the friendliness of the local people greeting you along the way and enjoy the beautiful views of the neighborhood.After that, you will explore the Eco-Village Cam Thanh which is associated with the heroic history of the anti-French and anti-American war by taking a paddle boat trip in a unique Vietnamese bamboo basket boat down the waterways of a coconut palm paradise.Then you meet and engage with local fishermen, enjoy a hands-on experience of traditional net fishing and “Purple Crabs” in the canal, get some loveable handmade gifts from nipa palm leaves like hats, watches, rings ...After the boat trip, have a delicious lunch in our restaurant and cycle back to your hotel.

itinerary_desc: Have a free day to explore Hoi An at your own pace. The best way to explore this charming town is to rent a bicycle at the hotel and cycle around the town towards the riverside or the beach. At the beach, you will find many small cafes where you could relax with a fresh fruit drink after swimming. The water in the sea is warm and calm.You could visit a tailor-shop which could make you and your loved ones a new piece of clothes, bag or shoes overnight.In the evening we recommend you to walk around the Old Town area, which looks charming when the shops light their lanterns. You and would really feel like being in a fairy-tale. And don’t skip the colourful performances organized on the street in the evening.

You will be blown away by the stunning views of the mountains and the sea. Upon arrival in Hue check in the hotel and have free time to explore the surrounding area.

Discover the best of Vietnam with our 10-day tour package. From the bustling city of Hanoi to the tranquil waters of Halong Bay, the historic town of Hoi An, and the vibrant metropolis of Ho Chi Minh City, this tour will take you on an unforgettable journey through Vietnam's rich culture and stunning landscapes.

Welcome to Hanoi, Vietnam! On your first day, you can arrive in Hanoi at any time as the only activity scheduled is the airport pick up. A Legend Travel Group car driver will be waiting for you at the airport to take you to your hotel. Once you have checked in, the rest of the day is free for you to rest or explore the city and form your own first impressions of Vietnam. The airport transfer is included in the itinerary, so you don't have to worry about arranging transportation on your own.

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, you will be picked up by our friendly guide to begin your exploration of Hanoi City. The first stop will be at Tran Quoc Pagoda, located on Golden Fish Island in West Lake. This pagoda is the oldest in Hanoi and was built in the 6th century. Admire the stunning architecture and learn about the history and culture of this important landmark.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, our mini-van/bus will pick you up between 8:30 am to 9:00 am to begin your journey to Halong City. During the 3.5-hour drive, you will have the opportunity to view the simple countryside and rice paddy life along the way. Once you arrive at the port, you will board your private boat - an authentic Chinese Junk - and begin your amazing cruise through the stunning Halong Bay, a World Heritage Site. Lunch will be served on board and will consist of a selection of the freshest seafood.

Wake up early in the morning to witness a beautiful sunrise and breathe in the fresh ocean air. Enjoy breakfast served on the boat as we leisurely cruise through thousands of stunning and seemingly never-ending islands. This is an amazing opportunity to capture some breathtaking photographs of the scenery. We will also make a stop to visit a floating fishing village and hear legendary stories of the fishermen's daily life.

Enjoy a full-day excursion to Hoi An, a charming and historic trading center that was once known as “Faifo” to the earliest Western traders. It was also an important port for the Dutch, Portuguese, Italian, Chinese, Japanese, and other merchant vessels from the Far East.

After having breakfast at the hotel, you will leave at 8:00 am to visit My Son, a UNESCO World Heritage site located 50 km southwest of Hoi An. My Son was once a capital and religious center of the Cham people and is now home to red brick towers and sanctuaries. It is considered to be one of Southeast Asia's greatest archaeological sites, along with Angkor in Cambodia, Bagan in Myanmar, Ayutthaya in Thailand, and Borobudur in Indonesia. The towers and sanctuaries were built between the 7th and 13th centuries.

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, you have the morning free to relax or indulge in some shopping in Hoi An. Later, you will be transferred to the airport for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City. Upon arrival, a friendly and professional driver will be waiting to pick you up and transfer you to your hotel for check-in.

After enjoying breakfast at the hotel, embark on a fascinating journey through the highlights of Ho Chi Minh City. Visit the Notre Dame Cathedral, a stunning example of neo-Romanesque architecture built by the French in the 19th century. Next, stop at the historic Central Post Office, designed by Gustave Eiffel and featuring a beautiful interior of intricate maps, intricate designs, and arched windows. Then, explore the Reunification Palace, the former presidential palace of South Vietnam and a symbol of the country's tumultuous past.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, your tour guide will pick you up at 8:00 am to start your journey to My Tho, the capital city of Tien Giang Province. This picturesque city is located on the Mekong River, about 75 kilometers southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, and is known for its lush orchards and rice fields that produce grains for the entire country.

We designed this tour programme with focus on the Northern and North-eastern mountainous areas of Vietnam where photographers, amateurs or professionals, will encounter breath-taking natural landscapes, colourful ethnic minorities and authentic experiences all year round. Vietnam’s northernmost province of Ha Giang offers some of the most striking sceneries with the rock formations and bizarre landscape in Dong Van rock plateau, a UNESCO World Geopark. Other highlights of the tour includes the beautiful Ban Gioc Waterfall on the Sino-Vietnamese border and Ba Be National Park with homestay and kayaking on Ba Be Lake, one of the rare karsts mountain lakes in the world which never dries

This morning, we drive to Ha Giang, the most stunning and less-visited province of Vietnam.

After breakfast, we head to Dong Van karst plateau geopark. Our drive will take us over high passes and we can view deep valleys along the entire journey. We’ll stop along the way to visit Pho Bang old town, Lung Cam culture village of the H'Mong minority, the Vuong Palace which was the seat of government for the Hmong during the first Indochina war.

After having breakfast, we continue on to the town of Meo Vac, a small outpost, but won’t be disappointing as it the starting point to a wildly scenic road, one of the top 5 of Vietnam. Below, the Nho Que river flows and above, the towering cliff rises to the clouds, a truly beautiful gorge below is completes one of the most spectacular natural sights in the country. Take your time and soak it up, as this is one journey to savor!

Today, we drive to Ban Gioc Waterfall, a very scenic spot on the border with China. Ban Gioc also ranked as one of world's largest waterfalls on the border line; On the way back, we may have time to stop at several giant irrigation water - wheels that lies along the road overlooking villages. We also visit to Nguom Ngao Cave and a village of a Nung minority to learn about their life and culture.
Starting from hotel in Cao Bang for transferring to Ba Be Lake, famous for its immense crystal water.

­ Discover Northern Vietnam highlights where ancient history and stunning landscapes collide. Travel from the modern capital to the first capital city, Hoa Lu and admire ancient relics. Meet the Hmong people and other minority villagers on a hilltribe excursion in Sapa.  Explore the limestone karsts and rice paddies of ‘Halong on Land’ before boarding a boat to cruise the real Halong Bay.  This trip offers great value as it introduces the region’s main sights, providing plenty of flexibility so you can experience an adventure you'll never forget
Our driver will pick up you from Hanoi airport then take you to hotel.

This full day tour takes you around Hanoi’s most interesting sights. Firstly, you will visit Tran Quoc Pagoda - the oldest pagoda in Hanoi. After that we explore the Ho Chi Minh Complex including Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, House-on-Stilts, the Presidential Palace, One Pillar Pagoda. Then visit Vietnam Ethnology Museum to learn about the culture of 54 ethnic groups living in the whole country of Vietnam.
07h00 – 8h00: Get picked up by our friendly guide then depart for Ninh Binh province.
05:30 ~ 06:00: Arrive at Lao Cai Train Station. Pick up at the train station and transfer to Sapa for breakfast. Relax for a while to get ready for our full day tour.
In the morning, have breakfast at the hotel and then check out.

Early risers can enjoy a memorable sunrise over the karst formations of Halong Bay. Breakfast will be served shortly thereafter.

Vietnam Intro is the most amazing way to experience Vietnam! You’ll discover crazy Hanoi, experience the stunning Ha Long Bay, go sea kayaking, crab fishing with traditional fisherman, soak up fascinating local culture, learn to cook delicious Vietnamese food and much more. Plus you’ll have an awesome group leader with you from the moment you step off the plane, an instant group of friends to share your adventure with and help with all your onward travel. Get ready for the trip of a lifetime!

When you land in Hanoi after your long flight we’ll be at the airport to meet you and take you to your accommodation. You’ll have plenty of time to recover from your flight, chill out and meet everyone in your group.

Discover what makes the chaotic capital of Vietnam so special with a walking and rickshaw tour of the city. Experience the bustling streets, fascinating culture and delicious street food. We’ll then head out for dinner and experience some of Hanoi’s best nightlife!

Experience the stunning natural wonder of Ha Long Bay, cruise on beautiful emerald green waters through towering limestone mountains topped with rainforest. Go kayaking through caves and enjoy some drinks aboard our overnight boat!

Today we head south to the beautiful countryside of Ninh Binh, a landscape of endless rice paddies and epic limestone mountains. Check in to our unique and amazing local homestay and watch the sunset whilst relaxing in our private riverside bungalows for the evening.

Today we explore magical Ninh Binh. We’ll take a bike ride through the rice paddies and then a local row boat along a network of rivers and caves. We’ll then tackle the iconic Dragon Mountain Viewpoint before boarding the overnight train south to Hoi An.

In the morning we’ll arrive in Hoi An, one of the most beautiful and fascinating towns in Vietnam. You’ll have some time in the afternoon to chill out, go shopping or even get some clothes made! This evening we'll experience the iconic lantern boats.
Be guided through coconut groves by local fishermen while you try your hand at some crab fishing! We’ll then learn the secrets of preparing delicious Vietnamese food with a traditional cooking class.
This morning we'll learn how to make lanterns. We'll then enjoy a chilled day at a beach club. That evening we'll head out for our farewell dinner together.

Xin chao! Welcome to Hanoi. Your adventure begins with a welcome meeting at 6 pm at your hotel, followed by a group dinner at KOTO restaurant – this organisation is dedicated to developing the hospitality careers of disadvantaged youth.

Travel by private minibus to the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Ha Long Bay, which is dotted with sandy coves, grottoes and 1600 limestone islands, formed over millennia by wind and water erosion. Board a private boat and cruise the bay, exploring Surprise Cave and Ti Top Island Beach. If you like, you can also take on an optional kayaking tour of the bay and see the gorgeous natural scenery from a different perspective. Spend your evening aboard the boat beneath the night sky, watching as the stars come out and maybe grab a drink at the restaurant bar, getting to know your fellow travellers a little better.
Wake up on the waters of Ha Long Bay and maybe watch the sunrise as the eagles soar overhead.

Arrive in Hue this morning and transfer to your hotel. Once the imperial capital of Vietnam, Hue holds the treasures of the country’s royal past. Enjoy free time in the morning to rest or explore – you could check out the bustling Dong Ba Market to sample some of the specialties that once graced the Nguyen emperors' tables. Reunite with the group to visit the war-damaged ruins of the Imperial Citadel – a sprawling city-within-a-city which contains the remains of temples, state houses and the emperor’s palace.
See Hue like a local today – from the back of a motorbike! Straddle the saddle and whiz around town with a local guide, taking in historic and contemporary sights along the way.

This morning, take the bus through coastal rice paddies and the spectacular Hai Van Pass. After a photo stop on the way, arrive in Hoi An – recently declared a UNESCO World Heritage site. Hoi An was a major international trading port during the 17th, 18th and 19th centuries. Today, parts of the beautifully preserved town retain the feel of centuries past. This is also a very popular town for shopping, famous for its many tailors.

Today is a free day to explore Hoi An. Maybe browse the cobbled streets and art galleries or hire a bike and cycle through rice paddies out to Cua Dai Beach. Maybe browse for paintings, ceramics and colourful cloth lanterns in the town’s markets and preserved Chinese shophouses. If you’re craving a new look, you could visit to one of the hundreds of tailors and get an outfit custom made. Hoi An is also known for its delicious regional food, so you could have dinner a riverside restaurant or partake in a cooking class.

Today, you’ll take a short, early morning flight to Ho Chi Minh City. Formerly known as Saigon, Ho Chi Minh City has a fascinating history and is arguably Vietnam’s capital of commerce and culture. After landing, take a sightseeing tour around the city by bus. Pass the Reunification Palace, Notre Dame Cathedral and the Opera House, then stop in at the War Remnants Museum to discover some of the sobering stories of the 20-year-long Vietnam/American War.
This morning, head out on a daytrip to explore the Mekong Delta.

Imagine stepping into a living story, where every moment brings a new chapter of Vietnam to life.Our Vietnam Best Deal in 10 Daystour invites you to explore the heart of Hanoi’s ancient streets. Picture yourself surrounded by the stunning limestone peaks of Ninh Binh. Sail through the emerald waters of Ha Long Bay. Wander the lantern-lit streets of Hoi An. And then, feel the pulse of Ho Chi Minh City. This isn’t just a trip, it’s an unforgettable experience, one that lets you taste, feel, and live the magic of Vietnam.

You can easily explore the city at your own pace or relax at the hotel after the flight.

Your cultural journey through Hanoi begins as your tour guide and driver pick you up from your hotel. The first stop is Tran Quoc Pagoda, a tranquil Buddhist sanctuary on Golden Fish Island in West Lake. Built in the 6th century, it is the oldest pagoda in Hanoi, reflecting Vietnam’s rich spiritual heritage.

Your journey begins at 7:30 AM when our tour guide picks you up at your hotel in Hanoi. We set off towards Ninh Binh province, located about 120 km away. After a scenic drive, we take a short 20-minute break to relax before continuing our trip.

The sun rises on Halong in the morning, and breakfast is served while the vessel cruises slowly back toward the port. Enjoy an early lunch before arriving at the port and disembarking. You will be transferred to the airport in Hanoi to take your flight to Hoi An.

Have a free day to explore Hoi An at your own pace. The best way to explore this charming town is to rent a bicycle at the hotel and cycle around town towards the riverside or the beach. At the beach, you will find many small cafés where you can relax with a fresh fruit drink after swimming. The water in the sea is warm and calm.

itinerary_desc: Take a morning trip to visit the Independence Palace, also known as the Reunification Palace, which was built on the site of the former Norodom Palace. The Independence Palace is a well-known landmark of Ho Chi Minh City and was designed by the architect Ngo Viet Thu. Continue to see the beautiful structures from the French Colonial era, such as the Notre Dame Cathedral and the historic Central Post Office. Follow this with a visit to the remarkable War Remnants Museum, which features an extensive display covering both Indochina wars.

Overview
Welcome to Hanoi! Upon arrival at Noi Bai International Airport, our local driver will be waiting to greet you and take you to your hotel. Your room will be ready for check-in from 2:00 PM.

Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam, is a city with over 1,000 years of rich history. Its ancient charm is reflected in iconic sites like Tran Quoc Pagoda, Ho Chi Minh Complex, One Pillar Pagoda, the Vietnam Ethnology Museum, Vietnamese Women’s Museum, Temple of Literature, and Hoa Lo Prison. These landmarks come together to tell the story of a city steeped in tradition and heritage.

Spend a full day exploring the breathtaking landscapes and rich history of Ninh Binh, often called “Halong Bay on land.” Start your journey at Hoa Lu, the ancient capital of Vietnam, where you’ll step back in time and admire centuries-old temples dedicated to Vietnam’s early emperors. After a delicious local lunch, enjoy a relaxing boat ride through the UNESCO-listed Trang An landscape, famous for its stunning caves, lush rivers, and dramatic limestone karsts — a setting so incredible it was featured in the movie Kong: Skull Island. By evening, return comfortably to Hanoi with memories of one of Vietnam’s most unique regions.

Ha Long Bay, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Quảng Ninh Province, is one of northern Vietnam’s most breathtaking natural wonders. Near the Chinese border, this spectacular bay stretches over 1,500 square kilometres and is dotted with about 1,600 limestone islands and islets, each with its own unique shape and story. Saving Ha Long Bay for last means you get to end your trip with one of the most unforgettable experiences Vietnam has to offer!

Halong Bayis a natural wonder of the world and a UNESCO World Heritage site, and once you arrive there, you will understand why. Get ready to be amazed by the world's most breathtaking views, and have a relaxing time on the cruise, enjoying the exciting activities we have prepared for you.

The sun rises on Halong in the morning, and breakfast is served while the vessel cruises slowly back toward the port. Enjoy an early lunch before arriving at the port and disembarking. You will be transferred to the airport in Hanoi to take your flight toHo Chi Minh.

Cu Chi, located 70 km out of Ho Chi Minh, was known as the “area of steel” in wartime. It has a system of tunnels over 200km, which was considered the unbreakable underground village in the Vietnam-American war. Today you will have a chance to touch the history and learn more about people's lives during the war.

Mekong Deltais one of the most important regions of Vietnam, which supplies rice and fruits for the entire country. This is why Mekong Delta is also called the "rice bowl" o Vietnam. Exploring the maze of mangrove-lined riverways and visiting the local workshops and gardens will be a highlight of your holiday and will show you the countryside life of Southern Vietnam.

This package is tailored for travelers with limited time who want to experience the best of Vietnam from North to South and gain an understanding of Vietnamese culture. The tour promises to showcase Vietnam’s natural beauty and provide insight into the everyday lives of the Vietnamese people, both past and present. This suggests a well-rounded itinerary that balances scenic attractions with cultural immersion

Upon arrival at Tan Son Nhat Airport, after clearing all customs procedures, please proceed to exit gate and look for your driver who will be waiting at the lobby, holding the Wonderscape signboard with your name on it. You will be transferred to the hotel by private transportation. Check-in to the hotel and get over the jet lag. Check in time at 2PM

Leaving the hustle and bustle of Ho Chi Minh City, start your trip to depart for My Tho, the town lies on the left side of the Mekong River. Upon arrival, visit Vinh Trang pagoda which dates back to the late 19th century. Then board the sampan and cruise down the river around the four beautiful islands known as Dragon, Unicorn, Phoenix and Tortoise islands. Stop over at Unicorn Island, go walking around country lane and seeing orchards, enjoy tropical fruits, folk song music which is performed by the local people. Visit the fruit plantation. Ride a hand-rowed sampan through Thoi Son canal and treat yourself to the beauty of the countryside, visit the family business, visit a honey-bee farm, enjoy honey tea and a coconut candy workshop.

Morning depart for Cu Chi tunnel, the trip will take approximately one and a half hours bus driving. Upon arrival, before exploring the tunnels, you will have some short introduction followed by introductory video about how the tunnels were constructed and how the people survived in the harsh conditions of the war time. Then, spend your time to explore the remaining area and tunnel systems which included the special constructed living areas with kitchens, bedrooms side by side with other martial facilities like storage, weapons factories, field hospitals, and command centers helping whoever lives inside the tunnels meet their basic needs. Besides, there are also many hidden trap doors and dangerous traps within the maze-like tunnels for security purpose during the war. Afterward, special tea and cassava (guerilla’s food during the war) will be served.

In the morning, after breakfast at the hotel, the cruise team will pick you up. Take the most scenic route to reach Ha Long Bay, taking you across the Red River Delta with emerald green rice paddies stretching for as far as the eyes can see. On arrival to Ha Long- the natural wonders of Southeast Asia, you will enjoy a cruise trip on the Bay and explore the limestone rocks and the karst grottoes.

Wake up early in the morning to witness the stunning sunrise and take in the fresh ocean air. Enjoy a delicious breakfast served on the boat while cruising leisurely through thousands of breath taking islands in Ha Long Bay. This is a great opportunity to capture some amazing photos of the picturesque scenery.
11 Days of Unforgettable Experiences

Welcome to Hanoi, the vibrant capital city of Vietnam! Upon your arrival at Noi Bai International Airport, you will be warmly greeted by our friendly guide and driver. Enjoy a comfortable transfer to your luxurious 4-star hotel, where you will check-in and settle into your elegant accommodations.

Hanoi Jeep Tours is a fun way to experience the sights, smells and tastes of Hanoi NOT like a trip through the window of a mundane air-con car. And definitely, the best way to see and learn about the real Hanoi, not just the run-off-the-mill tourist sites. If you are looking for a way to see Hanoi in style, then Hanoi Jeep Tours is the one-of-a-kind tour for you!

Today, leave the hustle and bustle of Hanoi behind as you embark on a scenic drive to the stunning Halong Bay. Upon arrival, board a luxurious cruise ship that will be your home for the next two days. Set sail through the emerald waters, marveling at the majestic limestone karsts and serene beauty of this UNESCO World Heritage site. Enjoy gourmet meals, explore hidden caves, and participate in onboard activities, all while surrounded by the breathtaking landscapes of Halong Bay. Relax and unwind in your comfortable cabin as you drift into a peaceful night on the water.

After a memorable cruise on Halong Bay, enjoy a leisurely breakfast on board before returning to the harbor. From there, you’ll be transferred back to Hanoi. This morning see the Tran Quoc Pagoda. This 1,400 year old temple features ten tiers enclosed by gardens, including a bodhi tree grown from a cutting of the original Buddhist tree under which Buddha sat. Stroll around Hoan Kiem Lake where you’ll see the Tortoise Tower perched on the water. Enjoy a half hour cyclo tour through Hanoi’s the Old Quarter. The cyclo is a historic mode of transportation in the cities of Vietnam where a cyclist leads you while you sit in a canopied seat affixed to the front. Next, visit the One Pillar Pagoda, situated on a pillar made of a single stone, in the midst of a lotus pond. This pagoda was built by a 9th century emperor who saw it in a dream and regarded this as divine inspiration to recreate the structure in his vision.

After breakfast, travel to Halong Bay, one of the Wonders of the Orient (3 hr. drive). Your cruise across Halong Bay starts around noon on Tuan Chau Island at the doorstep of Vietnam's most fascinating wonder. As the boat sets sails, you will be greeted by the Paradise Crew and Cruise Manager who will aim throughout your stay at providing you with the highest standards of service for pure pleasure and utmost comfort onboard.

Wake up to Tai Chi exercises on the sun deck and continue cruising the bays. Breakfast buffet will be served in the restaurant, followed by a visit the limestone grotto. Disembark in Halong City around noon and transfer back to Hanoi airport and flight to Danang. upon arrive , you will escort to Hoi An for hotel check in. Overnight in Hoi An.

In the morning, travel to the My Son Holy Land. Tucked in the mountains up winding roads with serene views, lie  the 4th century My Son Holy Land ruins. The surrounding mountains are strictly forbidden for living or development. The ruins lie in a beautiful mountainous landscape. Enter the temples to hear all about the history and stories of the Cham people and this holy site.
Take a flight to Saigon. Upon arrival, guide will meet at the airport and lead you to the hotel. Then you can have a rest. Overnight in Saigon.

This morning, escort to visit the Cu Chi Tunnels. Discover these amazing systems developed by the guerrillas fighting in the Vietnam War. You'll have an opportunity to see the various weapons used in the war on display. Then learn about the innovative ways the guerrillas survived and fought back in the war. The impressive underground system they built remains to tell the story of the Vietnam War.

Today you will discover the Mekong River and villages at the Mekong Delta region, essential to Vietnamese life. Your private guide and car will take you to the remote My Tho. This burgeoning capital rests in the Mekong Delta and is surrounded by beautiful countryside known as the "rice basket of Vietnam".

Experience the best of Vietnam from the bustling streets of Ho Chi Minh City to the peaceful Mai Chau Valley in just 7 days! Our "Best of Vietnam from Saigon to Hanoi 7 Days - Super Save" tour package is designed to take you on a journey through the most popular and beautiful destinations in Vietnam. From exploring the Cu Chi Tunnels and the Mekong Delta to sailing on the majestic Halong Bay and immersing in the traditional culture of Mai Chau Valley, this tour will give you a taste of everything Vietnam has to offer.

This picturesque city is located on the Mekong River, about 75 kilometers southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, and is known for its lush orchards and rice fields that produce grains for the entire country.

Once you arrive at the port, you will board your boat - an authentic Chinese Junk - and begin your amazing cruise through the stunning Halong Bay, a World Heritage Site. Lunch will be served on board and will consist of a selection of the freshest seafood.

We will also make a stop to visit a floating fishing village and hear legendary stories of the fishermen's daily life.

My Son was chosen as a religious center, built in the late 4th century under the Cham’s King Bhadravaman. As a tower garden, My Son is a huge religious complex with over 70 towers and temples of different architectures. Wander through the elaborate carvings and sculptures of the Cham people, tourists are welcomed at the Old Tower of the Cham. Not only visit an interesting place, but also you can understand much more about the culture and civilization of ancient Champa people. Picture yourself traveling through Vietnam on ourUltimate 13-Day Vietnam Tour Experience,where you'll find a mix of old and new. You'll start in Hanoi, exploring its historic streets and temples, then journey to Sapa to trek through beautiful landscapes and meet local villagers. Cruising through Ha Long Bay, you'll see stunning limestone islands. In Hoi An, wander through its charming old town, and in Ho Chi Minh City, discover the stories of the past. This trip is about connecting with Vietnam's culture, seeing its natural beauty, and making memories that last.

Your Vietnam adventure begins with your arrival in Hanoi. Your private driver will meet you at the airport, holding a signboard with your name. He will escort you to your accommodation right in the heart of the city, with the fascinating Old Quarter at your fingertips. You can easily explore the city at your own pace or relax at the hotel after the flight.

Your cultural journey through Hanoi begins as your tour guide and driver pick you up from your hotel. The first stop is Tran Quoc Pagoda, a tranquil Buddhist sanctuary on Golden Fish Island in West Lake. Built in the 6th century, it is the oldest pagoda in Hanoi, reflecting Vietnam’s rich spiritual heritage.

Today, your adventure begins with a comfortable drive from Hanoi to Sapa. As you leave the bustling capital behind, the landscape slowly transforms into rolling hills and lush greenery. Along the way, you'll witness the stunning beauty of northern Vietnam—terraced rice fields that shimmer in the sunlight or disappear into the morning mist, creating a scene right out of a painting.

Have breakfast at the hotel. Meet your guide around 9:30 AM and start your 12 km trek, visiting Y Linh Ho and Lao Chai villages of the Hmong minority. Along the way, enjoy the scenic beauty of the rice terraces and mountain peaks.

Enjoy the local breakfast at the homestay and get ready for trekking. We will leave around 9:30 AM and hike for about 8 km, visiting two villages of the Red Dzao and Hmong minorities: Giang Ta Chai and Su Pan.

Your journey begins at 7:30 AM when our tour guide picks you up at your hotel in Hanoi. We set off towards Ninh Binh province, located about 120 km away. After a scenic drive, we take a short 20-minute break to relax before continuing our trip.

Welcome to Hanoi – Vietnam’s charming capital city, where ancient traditions meet dynamic modern life. Upon arrival atNoi Bai International Airport, you’ll be warmly greeted by our local driver and transferred to your hotel in the heart of the city.

Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam, is a city steeped in over a thousand years of rich history. It stands as a solemn ancient city where you can explore remarkable heritage sites and traditional architecture. Highlights include Tran Quoc Pagoda, Ho Chi Minh Complex, One Pillar Pagoda, Vietnam Ethnology Museum, Vietnamese Women’s Museum, Temple of Literature, and Hoa Lo Prison. Together, these sites offer a deep dive into Hanoi’s historical and cultural soul. Beyond its architecture, Hanoi invites you to fully immerse yourself in its unique local culture.

This morning, say goodbye to Ho Chi Minh City and fly north to Danang. From here you’ll take a bus to Hoi An, with the five spectacular peaks of the Marble Mountains as a backdrop.
Enjoy a free day in the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Hoi An.

Leave Hoi An today and journey across the dramatic Hai Van Pass – a sometimes bumpy but incredibly scenic stretch of highway with views of Lang Co Beach. Make a quick photo stop on the way, then continue to Hue – the former imperial capital of Vietnam. When you arrive, join your leader for a tour of the Imperial Citadel – this fortress houses the Imperial City and the citadel-within-a-citadel, the Forbidden Purple City. This icon was almost completely destroyed during the Vietnam/American War, and the ruins and holes left by bombs are a reminder of the destruction that was caused. In your free time you might like to visit Dong Ba Market, which offers locally made goods, fresh produce and tantalising street food.

Today’s adventure will be on the back of a motorbike! You’ll have your own driver who will take you around the Imperial Citadel and Thien Mu Pagoda – the unofficial symbol of Hue. This site dates back to 1601 and is still an active Buddhist monastery.

Arrive in Hanoi early this morning and transfer to your hotel. Vietnam’s capital is famous for its beautiful lakes, shaded boulevards, public parks and beautiful Old Quarter. Soak up some free time to relax, then take a walking tour through the city. In your free time, maybe wander through the '36 Streets’ of the historic Old Quarter, chill out by the beautiful Hoan Kiem Lake, or visit the Fine Arts Museum. This museum plays a crucial role in maintaining and promoting the cultural heritage of Vietnam’s ethnic communities.

Travel by private minibus to the spectacular UNESCO World Heritage site of Ha Long Bay. This is one of Vietnam’s most beautiful places, a secluded bay of emerald waters flecked with limestone islands and caves. When you arrive, you’ll hop on a cruise to explore Surprise Cave and the surrounding rock formations.
Wake up on the waters of Ha Long Bay – if you’re keen, you could watch the sunrise from the deck this morning, watching the bay come alive with eagles, fishermen and sunlight.

Immerse yourself in the vibrant culture and stunning landscapes of Vietnam on this 10-day tour. From the bustling streets of Ho Chi Minh City to the tranquil waters of Halong Bay, this itinerary is designed to showcase the best of this beautiful country. Explore the Mekong Delta, discover the history of the Cu Chi Tunnels, wander the charming streets of Hoi An, and marvel at the ancient ruins of My Son Sanctuary. End your journey in the charming capital of Hanoi, where you'll enjoy a full day of sightseeing and a memorable overnight cruise on Halong Bay. With comfortable accommodations, knowledgeable guides, and delicious cuisine, this tour is the perfect introduction to Vietnam.

Welcome to Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam! On your first day, you will arrive at the airport at your preferred time as the only scheduled activity for the day is the airport pickup. A friendly driver from Legend Travel Group will be waiting to greet you at the airport and transport you to your hotel. Once you have checked in, you can take the rest of the day to relax and settle in, or explore the city on your own to get a feel for the local culture and attractions.

After enjoying breakfast at the hotel, embark on a fascinating journey through the highlights of Ho Chi Minh City. Visit the Notre Dame Cathedral, a stunning example of neo-Romanesque architecture built by the French in the 19th century. Next, stop at the historic Central Post Office, designed by Gustave Eiffel and featuring a beautiful interior of intricate maps, intricate designs, and arched windows. Then, explore the Reunification Palace, the former presidential palace of South Vietnam and a symbol of the country's tumultuous past.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, your tour guide will pick you up at 8:00 am to start your journey to My Tho, the capital city of Tien Giang Province. This picturesque city is located on the Mekong River, about 75 kilometers southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, and is known for its lush orchards and rice fields that produce grains for the entire country.

After breakfast at the hotel, you have the day at leisure to explore Ho Chi Minh City on your own or indulge in some shopping until it's time for your flight to Hoi An. Upon arrival, you will be picked up at the airport and transferred to your hotel in Hoi An for check-in. The rest of the day is free for you to relax, explore the city or go shopping. Enjoy an overnight stay in Hoi An.

Enjoy a full-day excursion to Hoi An, a charming and historic trading center that was once known as “Faifo” to the earliest Western traders. It was also an important port for the Dutch, Portuguese, Italian, Chinese, Japanese, and other merchant vessels from the Far East.

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, the group will depart at 8:30 am for a scenic drive to My Son Sanctuary, a UNESCO World Heritage site located 50 km southwest of Hoi An. My Son was once a capital and religious center of the Cham people and is now renowned for its well-preserved red brick towers and sanctuaries. These architectural marvels were constructed between the 7th and 13th centuries and are considered among the finest archaeological sites in Southeast Asia, alongside the likes of Angkor in Cambodia, Bagan in Myanmar, Ayutthaya in Thailand, and Borobudur in Indonesia.

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, you will be picked up by our friendly guide to begin your exploration of Hanoi City. The first stop will be at Tran Quoc Pagoda, located on Golden Fish Island in West Lake. This pagoda is the oldest in Hanoi and was built in the 6th century. Admire the stunning architecture and learn about the history and culture of this important landmark.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, our mini-van/bus will pick you up between 8:30 am to 9:00 am to begin your journey to Halong City. During the 3.5-hour drive, you will have the opportunity to view the simple countryside and rice paddy life along the way. Once you arrive at the port, you will board your boat - an authentic Chinese Junk - and begin your amazing cruise through the stunning Halong Bay, a World Heritage Site. Lunch will be served on board and will consist of a selection of the freshest seafood.

Wake up early in the morning to witness a beautiful sunrise and breathe in the fresh ocean air. Enjoy breakfast served on the boat as we leisurely cruise through thousands of stunning and seemingly never-ending islands. This is an amazing opportunity to capture some breathtaking photographs of the scenery. We will also make a stop to visit a floating fishing village and hear legendary stories of the fishermen's daily life.

There is no easier way to get under the skin of a country than through food, and thisGinger and Lemongrass – Vietnam Culinary Tour in 11 Daystour includes encounters with locals who will teach you the secrets of Vietnamese cuisine and give you a unique insight into Vietnam customs and culture. Your vacation begins with the charming capital, Hanoi, touring the city’s “must-sees”, and diving into Hanoi’s deep-rooted food culture by visiting local markets and sampling street fares in hidden alleys with a local food expert. You can catch the good options for Cha Ca, Bun Cha, and Pho, the signature of Vietnamese food that will come up to anyone’s mind when coming to Vietnam.

Your Vietnam adventure begins with your arrival inHanoi. Your private driver will meet you at the airport, holding a signboard with your name. He will escort you to your accommodation right in the heart of the city, with the fascinating Old Quarter at your fingertips. You can easily explore the city at your own pace or relax at the hotel after the flight.

Today’s tour begins at 08:30 or 15:30. Travel to Chef Ai‘s House for the start of an exciting Hanoi cooking class. Meet with Ms. Ai, who is passionate about Vietnamese cuisine, with about 15- years of experience, and in the top 5 of Master Chef Vietnam 2014.

In the morning, check out of the hotel and get picked up by the Cruise team. Take the most scenic route to reach Halong Bay, taking you across the Red River Delta with emerald green rice paddies stretching for as far as the eyes can see. On arrival at the pier, you will board the cruise andenjoy the fantastic views of limestone rocks and the karst grottoes. Have an utterly delicious seafood lunch and enjoy the time at the sundeck exploring the Bay. The cruise will stop in a secret place where you will spend timekayaking or swimming, so you can explore the karst grottoes closer. Towards the evening, you will return to the boat for an early dinner, followed by some time at leisure. You can optionally attend the activities taking part on the boat or just relax.
Rise early today to view the sunrise at the wonder of nature with breakfast served in the dining room.

Start today's explorations of Hue with a visit to the Imperial Citadel, a grand UNESCO-listed complex where the Nguyen Dynasty ruled between 1802 and 1945. After exploring the ruins of this vast monument, take a cyclo ride through the Old City to Tinh Tam Lake, where the Emperors used to come to relax. Decorated with blooming lotus flowers in summer, this peaceful spot is popular with university students who come to study at the many local-style coffee shops along the shore.

Have breakfast at the hotel and get ready for the transfer from Hue to Hoi An by private car. You will drive through one of the most beautiful roads in the world - Hai Van Pass. You will be blown away by the stunning views of the mountains and the sea. Upon arrival in Hoi An check in the hotel and have free time to explore the surrounding area.

Have a free day to explore Hoi An at your own pace. The best way to explore this charming town is to rent a bicycle at the hotel and cycle around the town towards the riverside or the beach. At the beach, you will find many small cafes where you could relax with a fresh fruit drink after swimming. The water in the sea is warm and calm.

Welcome to the best of Northern Vietnam tour package with Legend Travel Group. This 6-day itinerary is carefully crafted to showcase the beauty and culture of Northern Vietnam. From the charming streets of Hanoi to the majestic mountains of Sapa and the breathtaking Halong Bay, this tour has it all. With experienced guides, comfortable transportation, and carefully selected accommodations, you will have an unforgettable experience. Let's dive into the highlights of the tour!

Welcome to Hanoi, Vietnam! On your first day, you can arrive in Hanoi at any time as the only activity scheduled is the airport pick up. A Legend Travel Group car driver will be waiting for you at the airport to take you to your hotel. Once you have checked in, the rest of the day is free for you to rest or explore the city and form your own first impressions of Vietnam.
Having early breakfast at the hotel.
7:30 am - Enjoy breakfast at the hotel.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, our mini-van/bus will pick you up between 8:30 am to 9:00 am to begin your journey to Halong City. During the 3.5-hour drive, you will have the opportunity to view the simple countryside and rice paddy life along the way. Once you arrive at the port, you will board your boat - an authentic Chinese Junk - and begin your amazing cruise through the stunning Halong Bay, a World Heritage Site. Lunch will be served on board and will consist of a selection of the freshest seafood.

Wake up early in the morning to witness a beautiful sunrise and breathe in the fresh ocean air. Enjoy breakfast served on the boat as we leisurely cruise through thousands of stunning and seemingly never-ending islands. This is an amazing opportunity to capture some breathtaking photographs of the scenery. We will also make a stop to visit a floating fishing village and hear legendary stories of the fishermen's daily life.

ExploreVietnam Tour: Pu Luong Nature Reserve in 8 Days, which is filled with mountain ranges, caves, and clear-water rivers. Discover the different sides of Hanoi, travel to the outskirts, and learn about traditional green tea and local countryside life. Then head to Pu Luong. Unlike “the brother" Sapa, Pu Luong is less touristy and defined as a new paradise of Vietnam where time stood still and your mind will be broadened by the authentic insight into the life of ethnic minorities. Pu Luong was named by the Thai ethnic group which means " The highest peak of the region", but we are sure for you it will mean "the green paradise".

Your adventure begins with your arrival in Hanoi. Your private driver will meet you at the airport, holding a signboard with your name. He will escort you to your accommodation right in the heart of the city, with the fascinating Old Quarter at your fingertips. You can easily explore the city at your own pace or relax at the hotel after the flight.
Have breakfast at the hotel and meet your guide at the hotel lobby. The guide will escort you on the trip to Ba Vi, a countryside located on the outskirt of Hanoi.

Pick-up from your hotel in Hanoi. You will start the Pu Luong Adventure trip and be ready with 4 hours driving journey following Ho Chi Minh Trails (1B – National Highway). One stop on the haft way for a short break.

Have breakfast at the hotel and get ready for the trekking to the village of Kho Muong, which is home to about 65 families with over 300 White Thai people. In the local dialect, “Kho” is Origin, and “Muong” is Village so “Kho Muong” is understood as the place where people first settled in the whole area. The Kho Muong village was founded about 300 years ago by some hunters who were amazed by the flat valley with abundant water from streams and they moved all of their family, and neighbors and settled down here. Regarding location, it lies deep in the core zone of the Reserve, isolated from other villages in the region. In order to reach this village with a spectacular view of both mountain and valley.

Start early to descend into the beautiful valley facing the Retreat where you walk around tumbling rice terraces. Trek through small paths shrouded in vegetation to slowly reveal a picturesque village sitting at the base of a towering mountain. Your camera will not be able to sit still!

In the morning, check out of the hotel, and get picked up by the Cruise team. Take the most scenic route to reach Halong Bay, taking you across the Red River Delta with emerald green rice paddies stretching for as far as the eyes can see.

Rise early today to view the sunrise at the wonder of nature with breakfast served in the dining room. Then head off to visit the limestone cave full of stalagmites and stalactites. After your exploration return to the boat to check out and enjoy the brunch while the cruise is sailing back to the harbor. Later you will be transferred back to Hanoi.
Hello Vietnam – 11 Days of Discovery

itinerary_accommodation: Happy Life Green 3⭐⭐⭐ /Saigon Prague Hotel 3⭐ ⭐⭐/ Acnos Saigon Hotel 3⭐⭐⭐ or similar
itinerary_desc: Today you will discover theMekong Riverand villages at the Mekong Delta region, essential to Vietnamese life. Your guide and car will take you to the remoteMy Tho. This burgeoning capital rests in the Mekong Delta and is surrounded by beautiful countryside known as the "rice basket of Vietnam". First, you'll visitVinh Trang Pagodawhich is decorated with mosaics made from broken pottery. Overlooked by a tall white Buddha, it is set amongst lovely gardens packed with flowers, shrubs, lotus pools and tombs and ornate gates which provide entry. Next, you'll take a boat ride along the river to view the stilt houses, fruit plantations and fishing villages. You'll stop at the Tortoise Island where you'll enjoy lunch in the orchard.

Looking for a trip that’s all about culture, adventure, and making real memories? Our 15-day Vietnam tour is the one. You’ll kick things off with 12 days alongside an awesome crew, exploring everything from the colourful markets of Hanoi to the dreamy bays of Bai Tu Long. Then, the journey continues as you venture north to Sapa where you’ll experience terraced hills, hill tribe communities who’ve held onto their traditions for centuries, and a slower pace of life that feels worlds away. You’ll taste dishes passed down through generations, learn the secrets of rural Vietnam, and experience the country in a way most travellers never do. This isn’t just a trip, it’s Vietnam, from every angle, and it’s unforgettable.

Good Morning Vietnam! Your adventure kicks off with a pickup from the airport and a smooth ride to your hotel in HCMC. Once you're checked in, you've got the whole day to explore or chill out. Later, meet your crew for an epic welcome dinner with new friends. Cap it all off with a dip in the rooftop pool, taking in those stunning city views.

itinerary_accommodation: Overnight Train to Da Nang (4-Berth Multishare Cabin)
itinerary_desc: The former city of Saigon is a city that never slows down, but today you'll uncover its historic heart. Along the way, you will visit the grand General Post Office, a true colonial-era gem and one of Southeast Asia’s most beautiful post offices. Stroll down Rue Catinat, where you’ll pass elegant French colonial buildings, admire the restored Opera House, and see the Reunification Palace with its bold 60’s design. You’ll also stop by the People’s Committee Building and the iconic Notre Dame Cathedral, inspired by its Parisian namesake. After a refresh at the hotel, you’ll head to the station and board your overnight train to Da Nang.

This morning after arriving into Hoi An you'll be transfered straight to the kayak station in Cam Thanh. After a quick welcome and 15-minute paddle and safety briefing, it’s time to gear up with your life vest, paddle, and gloves. Your adventure today takes you along the Thu Bon River and through the lush nipa-palm forest of Thuan Tuan Island. While gliding across the water, you’ll also lend a hand to the community by collecting floating rubbish and helping to keep the riverbanks clean.

Rise and shine! This morning, you’ll cycle through the peaceful countryside of Cam Kim Island, passing lush rice paddies and farmlands at your own pace. Stop for photos or keep pedalling, the choice is yours. Along the way, you’ll join a meaningful hands-on workshop that turns used cooking oil into eco-friendly soap. You’ll learn how this simple yet powerful initiative prevents pollution, supports local women and youth with extra income, and protects Hoi An’s natural environment. After experiencing the impact for yourself (and even washing your hands with your creation), the afternoon is all yours. Hit the beach or keep exploring Hoi An’s charms.

Fuel up with breakfast, then get ready for a road trip to Hue in true style. You’ll journey up the iconic Hai Van Pass, famous for its sweeping coastal views and winding mountain roads. Along the way, stop at a hidden waterfall, enjoy lunch, and cruise through charming countryside backroads. By afternoon, you’ll roll into Hue, the historic Imperial City and former seat of the Nguyen Dynasty.

itinerary_accommodation: Overnight Train to Ninh Binh (4-berth Multishare Cabin)
itinerary_desc: This morning, you’ll be picked up from your hotel and head to Thuy Bieu village, taking in Hue’s beauty from a fresh perspective. Wander through the village, visit Luong Quan communal house, and explore the hundred-year-old garden home of Ho Xuan Dai, where you’ll join a hands-on cooking class. After a stop at the local market to learn about traditional ingredients, your host will guide you through preparing Hue’s signature dishes before you sit down to enjoy your creations. In the afternoon, step into history at the Imperial Citadel, then visit the iconic Thien Mu Pagoda, an active Buddhist monastery and one of Hue’s most enduring symbols. Return to the hotel for a short rest before boarding the night train to Ninh Binh.

Today, you’ll travel to Pu Luong National Park, one of Vietnam’s most stunning natural landscapes. Along the way, stop at the peaceful Chua Ngoc Chau Temple where you'll have some lunch before continuing to Don village, where you’ll settle into your traditional homestay.

After breakfast, you’ll set off from your homestay for a scenic trek through Pu Luong’s lush landscapes toward the beautiful Hieu Waterfalls. Take a refreshing swim in the cascading pools and enjoy a picnic lunch surrounded by nature. In the afternoon, walk back to the homestay at a relaxed pace, soaking up the peaceful countryside views. Tonight, enjoy a family-style dinner and free time to unwind.

Today you'll say goodbye to your homestay family and depart Pu Luong for Hanoi after a leisurely morning and breakfast. Upon afternoon arrival, check into your boutique hotel in the city center. In the evening, experience Hanoi's renowned culinary scene on a guided street food tour, sampling local specialties and hidden gems.

Today, you’ll leave the city behind and journey to the breathtaking Bai Tu Long Bay, a World Heritage-listed wonder that’s every bit as magical as its reputation. From the harbour, board your boat and cruise between towering limestone karsts rising from emerald waters. You'll also make a stop en route to visit a grotto of spectacular stalactites and stalagmites. Grab a paddle and kayak around the stunning scenery of Cap La Island. Fancy a dip? As the day winds down, you'll toast to new friends with sunset drinks and a delicious dinner on deck.

itinerary_accommodation: Overnight Sleeper Train to Sapa - 4 berth multishare cabin
itinerary_desc: Start your morning with a peaceful Tai Chi session on the sundeck, accompanied by tea, coffee, and light pastries as the bay drifts by. Spend the rest of the morning soaking up the scenery or simply relaxing on deck before enjoying brunch on board. Around 11.30am, you’ll return to Hanoi and have some time to refresh at Hanoi Sky Hotel before being trasferred to Hanoi Railway to take the overnight train to Lao Cai tonight.

itinerary_accommodation: Multishare Dorm Rooms – Ta Van Homestay (or similar)
itinerary_desc: Arriving in Sa Pa in the early morning, you’ll be met by your driver and transferred to your hotel to drop off your main luggage, bringing only a small overnight bag for your homestay. From there, meet your local guide and head straight to Ta Van Trek Point. Trek through the lush rice fields of Muong Hoa Valley and discover Ta Van village, where rural life moves at a slower pace, and friendly locals welcome you with warm smiles. After checking in at your homestay, enjoy some free time before sharing a delicious dinner with your hosts and experiencing an authentic night in the heart of Sapa.

Wake up to a delicious breakfast at your homestay. Around 9:00 AM, you’ll set out on a trek to Giang Ta Chai Village. Hike uphill to discover a beautiful waterfall and soak in breathtaking views. Giang Ta Chai is home to the Red Dao people, known for their distinctive black attire with embroidered details. You’ll enjoy lunch in the village before a steep descent.

itinerary_accommodation: Overnight sleeper train – 6 Berth Multi-Share Cabin
itinerary_desc: Today’s your final day in Sa Pa. After breakfast at your hotel, you’ll head out with your guide and car to an altitude of 1700m to visit the mesmerizing Silver Waterfall, where the Muong Hoa stream begins. Snap some stunning photos before continuing your journey through a wild forest road for about 3 km, reaching a red dirt path that winds through lush green bamboo forests. At the end of the bamboo forest, you’ll follow the stream to the breathtaking Love Waterfall. The waterfall resembles a hat from a distance, creating a picturesque scene in the vast space of mountains and forests. After soaking in the beauty of Love Waterfall, you’ll return to your car and head back to Sa Pa town to enjoy your final lunch in town.

Having the beauty of the majestic nature, Ban Gioc Waterfall can charm anyone who has ever heard about it. Considered as one of the most magnificent and beautiful waterfalls in Vietnam, Ban Gioc Waterfall is ranked in the top beautiful waterfalls in the world. A trip to Ban Gioc Waterfall will give you an exciting and fresh experience. But to make the trip more perfect, the following experience will be quite helpful to you.

Vietnam will surprise you with its rich traditional culture, world heritage sites, stunning inland scenery, and world-renowned cuisine. There, you can realize how diverse the area is and how rich orchard gardens are, which makes it the basket of fruit in the lower part of the Mekong River.

Welcome to Vietnam! This tour package is designed for travelers who don't have much time to explore Vietnam but want to experience the country's must-visit destinations. In just five days, you will have the chance to discover the ancient capital city of Hanoi, the stunning natural beauty of Halong Bay, and the spiritual Bai Dinh Pagoda and Trang An Complex.

Welcome to Hanoi, Vietnam! On your first day, you can arrive in Hanoi at any time as the only activity scheduled is the airport pick up. A Legend Travel Group car driver will be waiting for you at the airport to take you to your hotel. Once you have checked in, the rest of the day is free for you to rest or explore the city and form your own first impressions of Vietnam.

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, you will be picked up by our friendly guide to begin your exploration of Hanoi City. The first stop will be at Tran Quoc Pagoda, located on Golden Fish Island in West Lake. This pagoda is the oldest in Hanoi and was built in the 6th century. Admire the stunning architecture and learn about the history and culture of this important landmark.

After having breakfast at the hotel, we will pick you up at 8:30 am for a day tour of Bai Dinh pagoda & Trang An ecosystem in Ninh Binh province. The drive from Hanoi to Ninh Binh will take about 2 hours.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, our mini-van/bus will pick you up between 8:30 am to 9:00 am to begin your journey to Halong City. During the 3.5-hour drive, you will have the opportunity to view the simple countryside and rice paddy life along the way. Once you arrive at the port, you will board your boat - an authentic Chinese Junk - and begin your amazing cruise through the stunning Halong Bay, a World Heritage Site. Lunch will be served on board and will consist of a selection of the freshest seafood.

Discover the best of Vietnam with our 7-day tour package that takes you from the bustling city of Ho Chi Minh to the charming Mai Chau Valley and the stunning Halong Bay. Along the way, you will visit historical sites, explore local culture and enjoy breathtaking natural scenery. Our experienced guides will ensure you have an unforgettable adventure.

Welcome to Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam! On your first day, you will arrive at the airport at your preferred time as the only scheduled activity for the day is the airport pickup. Once you have checked in, you can take the rest of the day to relax and settle in, or explore the city on your own to get a feel for the local culture and attractions.

After enjoying breakfast at the hotel, embark on a fascinating journey through the highlights of Ho Chi Minh City. Next, stop at the historic Central Post Office, designed by Gustave Eiffel and featuring a beautiful interior of intricate maps, intricate designs, and arched windows. Then, explore the Reunification Palace, the former presidential palace of South Vietnam and a symbol of the country's tumultuous past.

After having breakfast at the hotel, you will be transferred to the airport for your early flight to Hanoi. Upon arrival, our friendly guide will pick you up and take you on a tour of Hanoi city. Admire the stunning architecture and learn about the history and culture of this important landmark.

After enjoying breakfast at the hotel, the itinerary begins with a departure from Hanoi at 8:30 am, embarking on a scenic drive along one of the most beautiful country roads to the tranquil Bakhan Village via Hoa Binh City. Along the way, travelers will get a chance to enjoy the picturesque natural beauty of the countryside.

itinerary_desc: Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam, is a city steeped in over a thousand years of rich history. Highlights include Tran Quoc Pagoda, Ho Chi Minh Complex, One Pillar Pagoda, Vietnam Ethnology Museum, Vietnamese Women’s Museum, Temple of Literature, and Hoa Lo Prison. Together, these sites offer a deep dive into Hanoi’s historical and cultural soul.

Welcome to Vietnam, a beautiful country with a rich history, stunning landscapes, and friendly people. This 9-day tour package will take you on a journey of discovery to some of Vietnam's most iconic destinations, including Hanoi, Halong Bay, Hoi An, Ho Chi Minh City, Cu Chi Tunnels, and Mekong Delta. Our carefully crafted itinerary has been designed to provide you with an authentic Vietnamese experience, allowing you to explore the country's culture, traditions, and cuisine.

The airport transfer is included in the itinerary, so you don't have to worry about arranging transportation on your own. Stay overnight in Hanoi and get ready for an exciting adventure!

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, you will be picked up by our friendly guide to begin your exploration of Hanoi City. The first stop will be at Tran Quoc Pagoda, located on Golden Fish Island in West Lake. This pagoda is the oldest in Hanoi and was built in the 6th century. Admire the stunning architecture and learn about the history and culture of this important landmark.

Wake up early in the morning to witness a beautiful sunrise and breathe in the fresh ocean air. Enjoy breakfast served on the boat as we leisurely cruise through thousands of stunning and seemingly never-ending islands. This is an amazing opportunity to capture some breathtaking photographs of the scenery. We will also make a stop to visit a floating fishing village and hear legendary stories of the fishermen's daily life.

Enjoy a full-day excursion to Hoi An, a charming and historic trading center that was once known as “Faifo” to the earliest Western traders. It was also an important port for the Dutch, Portuguese, Italian, Chinese, Japanese, and other merchant vessels from the Far East.

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, you have the morning free to relax or indulge in some shopping in Hoi An. Later, you will be transferred to the airport for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City. Upon arrival, a friendly and professional driver will be waiting to pick you up and transfer you to your hotel for check-in.

After enjoying breakfast at the hotel, embark on a fascinating journey through the highlights of Ho Chi Minh City. Visit the Notre Dame Cathedral, a stunning example of neo-Romanesque architecture built by the French in the 19th century. Next, stop at the historic Central Post Office, designed by Gustave Eiffel and featuring a beautiful interior of intricate maps, intricate designs, and arched windows. Then, explore the Reunification Palace, the former presidential palace of South Vietnam and a symbol of the country's tumultuous past.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, your tour guide will pick you up at 8:00 am to start your journey to My Tho, the capital city of Tien Giang Province. This picturesque city is located on the Mekong River, about 75 kilometers southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, and is known for its lush orchards and rice fields that produce grains for the entire country.

Discover all the incredible sights of Vietnam on a comprehensive ten-day tour from South to North of Vietnam! Visiting Ho Chi Minh City, Da Nang City, Hoi An Ancient Town, Hanoi and Ha Long Bay overnight on cruise, explore the Cu Chi tunnels, My Son Sanctuary, Hoi An Walking Town, Ha Long Bay and more

Upon arrival at Tan Son Nhat Airport, after clearing all customs procedures, please proceed to exit gate and look for your driver who will be waiting at the lobby, holding the Wonderscape signboard with your name on it. You will be transferred to the hotel by private transportation. Check-in to the hotel and get over the jet lag. Check in time at 2PM

Take the morning trip to visit Independence Palace, also known at the Reunification palace, was built on the sight of the former Norodom palace. The Independence palace is a widely known landmark of Ho Chi Minh City and was designed by the architect Ngo Viet Thu. Continue seeing the beautiful structures from the French Colonial times such as the Notre Dame Cathedral, the historic Central Post Office. Followed by the remarkable site of the War Remnants Museum the museum has a vast display of the both the Indochina wars.

Morning start visit My Tho city. With boat trip on Tien River, you will be excited by the light breeze from the river and the natural beauty of four beautiful islands such as Dragon, Unicorn, Phoenix and Tortoise along the riverside. Cruise through the small canal by sampan, treating yourself to the beauty of the countryside, and taking a short cycling around the village which will certainly be an unforgettable experience when participating in the Mekong Delta tour. Visit the coconut candy workshop, and enjoy seasonal delicious fruits & honey tea. Get a chance to listen to the Southern Vietnamese folk music which is performed by local people.

After breakfast at the hotel, you have the day at leisure to explore Ho Chi Minh City on your own or indulge in some shopping until it's time for your flight to Da Nang. Upon arrival, you will be picked up at the airport and transferred to your hotel in Hoi An for check-in. The rest of the day is free for you to relax, explore the city or go shopping.

This 5-day tour covers iconic landmarks in South Vietnam including the Cu Chi Tunnels and other top attractions in Ho Chi Minh City. Go under the surface of the Mekong Delta by visiting local villages and the famous Cai Rang Floating Market.

Upon arrival in Cai Be, have a boat ride to the remaining site of a renowned wholesale floating market on the Tien River many years ago. This site entitles you to learn something about the local trading habit that has changed due to the age of modern society when more terrestrial transportation and high techniques of agriculture have dominated everywhere. There, you can realize how diverse the area is and how rich orchard gardens are, which makes it the basket of fruit in the lower part of the Mekong River.

Breakfast at the hotel. Take a leisure boat trip to explore the picturesque tributaries of the Lower Mekong River (Bassac River) then visit to Cai Rang floating market which is the liveliest one in the whole of region.

Travel across Vietnam from Ha Noi to Ho Chi Minh City on this 11-day cultural journey. Cruise Ha Long Bay’s emerald waters, explore Ha Noi’s Old Quarter, and discover Hoi An’s timeless charm. Learn regional recipes, visit the ancient My Son Sanctuary, and uncover southern treasures from the Mekong Delta to the Cu Chi Tunnels. This itinerary blends heritage, food, and landscapes into an unforgettable adventure.
Pick-up at Noi Bai International airport. Transfer to your hotel. Overnight in Ha Noi.

The wondrous Ha Long Bay is truly one of Vietnam’s most impressive sights. Heading out of town, we will embark by boat for an exploration of legendary Ha Long Bay. Ha Long Bay is home to some 3000 limestone islands that rise out of the clear emerald water. The limestone karsts formations are littered with beaches, grottoes and beautiful caves.
After breakfast, swimming and sunbathing. After lunch, return to Ha Noi. Overnight in Ha Noi.

Free time at your leisure in the morning. In the afternoon, take the Ha Noi City tour. With ochre-colored colonial buildings, tree-lined boulevards and scenic lakes, Ha Noi is full of charms. Visit some of Ha Noi’s heritage sites such as Van Mieu - Quoc Tu Giam (Temple of Literature), the first Imperial school in Vietnam, built in 1070 during the dynasty of King Ly.

Exploring Hoi An Ancient Town on foot is one of the best ways to take in the city’s charm. While exploring this small yet beautiful town, tourists and frequent visitors find that it is a place of tranquility and peace. The unique atmosphere here combines elements of Vietnamese, Chinese and Japanese culture. Some of the most remarkable views of the town are from the Ancient Houses. From here, visitors can catch a glimpse of a long-gone past and more subdued and simple time.

Discover Hoi An’s countryside and its local foods by bicycle. Local foods in Hoi An are known and enjoyed by the tourists once setting foot here. In Hoi An, these cuisines are very popular and sold everywhere in all streets. Moreover, these cuisines are considered as unique symbols for the culture and introduced to every tourist.
Free time all day to explore Hoi An on your own or take an optional tour with Hoi An Express. Overnight in Hoi An.

After breakfast at the hotel, transfer to Da Nang airport to go to Ho Chi Minh City. Upon arrival at Tan Son Nhat airport, pick up and transfer to the hotel. Check in and relax. Overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.

A trip to Mekong Delta offers a glimpse into the unique and distinct agrarian life of the vibrant southern Delta region. We will enjoy a cruise along the Mekong River to one of the Islands (located in the town of My Tho) where we will be entertained with traditional music while enjoying some tea sweetened with bee’s honey and seasonal fresh fruits.

Start the day with a visit to the famous Cu Chi Tunnels. Stretching over 250 kilometers, Cu Chi is one of the most famous and historical aspects of war in Vietnam. The tunnel system was created in 1948 to assist the Viet Minh as they fought the French for independence and became legendary during the 1960s in playing a vital role in the Vietnam War by allowing the Viet Cong (communist guerrillas) to control large rural areas, just 65 kilometers away from Ho Chi Minh City.
Overview:
Upon arrival at Noi Bai Airport, pick you up and transfer to Hanoi center. Check in hotel and then free time at your leisure. Overnight at hotel in Hanoi.

This full day tour takes you around Hanoi’s most interesting sights. Firstly, you will visit Tran Quoc Pagoda - the oldest pagoda in Hanoi. After that we explore the Ho Chi Minh Complex including Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, House-on-Stilts, the Presidential Palace, One Pillar Pagoda. Then visit Vietnam Ethnology Museum to learn about the culture of 54 ethnic groups living in the whole country of Vietnam.
Just a couple hours’ drive outside of Hanoi and the tour heads deep into Vietnam’s picturesque countryside. You can choose an option below:

After breakfast, depart the capital for the drive to Halong Bay. Arrive to Halong City’s jetty (around noon) and proceed with check-in formalities. After a welcome onboard, lunch will be served while cruising towards the bay.
Early risers can enjoy a memorable sunrise over the karst formations of Halong Bay. Breakfast will be served shortly thereafter.

Embark on an unforgettable adventure through the heart of Vietnam with our "Vietnam Voyage: Central Marvels" tour. Explore the ancient town of Hoi An, with its lantern-lit streets and historic architecture, and visit the imperial city of Hue, known for its grand palaces and tombs. Relax on the pristine beaches of Da Nang and immerse yourself in the vibrant culture and history that make Central Vietnam a marvel to behold. To fully appreciate Vietnam's diversity, pair this tour with our "Northern Treasures" and "Southern Serenity" packages.
