Vietnam Intro is the most amazing way to experience Vietnam! You’ll discover crazy Hanoi, experience the stunning Ha Long Bay, go kayaking, crab fishing with traditional fisherman, soak up fascinating local culture, learn to cook delicious Vietnamese food, discover the secret underground world used during the Vietnam War known as the Cu Chi tunnels, explore the vast maze of rivers and lush green rice fields of the famous Mekong Delta and visit a traditional local village and much more. Plus you’ll have an awesome group leader with you from the moment you step off the plane, an instant group of friends to share your adventure with and help with all your onward travel. Get ready for the trip of a lifetime!

When you land in Hanoi after your long flight we’ll be at the airport to meet you and take you to your accommodation. You’ll have plenty of time to recover from your flight, chill out and meet everyone in your group.

Discover what makes the chaotic capital of Vietnam so special with a walking and rickshaw tour of the city. Experience the bustling streets, fascinating culture and delicious street food. We’ll then head out for dinner and experience some of Hanoi’s best nightlife!

Experience the stunning natural wonder of Ha Long Bay, cruise on beautiful emerald green waters through towering limestone mountains topped with rainforest. Go kayaking through caves and enjoy some drinks aboard our overnight boat!

Today we head south to the beautiful countryside of Ninh Binh, a landscape of endless rice paddies and epic limestone mountains. Check in to our unique and amazing local homestay and watch the sunset whilst relaxing in our private riverside bungalows for the evening.

Today we explore magical Ninh Binh. We’ll take a bike ride through the rice paddies and then a local row boat along a network of rivers and caves. We’ll then tackle the iconic Dragon Mountain Viewpoint before boarding the overnight train south to Hoi An.

In the morning we’ll arrive in Hoi An, one of the most beautiful and fascinating towns in Vietnam. You’ll have some time in the afternoon to chill out, go shopping or even get some clothes made! This evening we'll experience the iconic lantern boats.
Be guided through coconut groves by local fishermen while you try your hand at some crab fishing! We’ll then learn the secrets of preparing delicious Vietnamese food with a traditional cooking class.
This morning we'll learn how to make lanterns. We'll then enjoy a chilled day at a beach club. That evening we'll head out for our farewell dinner together.
Today we catch a short flight to Ho Chi Minh City and arrive early afternoon. You’ll have the rest of the day to relax and explore the city.

We’ll explore the incredibly lush green beauty of the Mekong Delta, learn first-hand how the locals live, visit local villages and experience daily life on the Mekong. We then stay overnight in the Delta.

Today we discover the Cu Chi Tunnels, a fascinating network of underground tunnels used as supply routes, hideouts and living quarters during the Vietnam War. We’ll arrive back to Ho Chi Minh City in the afternoon before heading out for our farewell dinner and party!

This eight-day adventure veers off the beaten path and into the wild and unspoilt beauty of Northern Vietnam. During the trip, you will trek through mountains, valleys and villages to discover the landscapes and cultures of Sapa and the frontier region of Ha Giang and Ban Gioc Waterfall before winding up in the sublime setting of Ba Be National Park.

Our guide and driver will pick you up around 7:30am for your 5 hour drive to Sapa. Simply sit back, relax, and enjoy as the scenery transforms from bustling metropolis to rolling hills and endless rice paddies.

After enjoying a delicious breakfast, we start our trek by heading to the Lao Chai and Ta Van village. On the way here there will be stunning scenery of rice paddies and small villages everywhere you look, and we’ll end the day by staying in a local homestay in Ta Van, allowing you to really get up close and personal with the culture and traditions here.
Today we’ll leave Sapa in favour of Vietnam’s final frontier, Ha Giang. We will have free time to relax in the morning before heading to Ha Giang by noon.

Once we have purchased the mandatory permit at the Immigration Office, you will begin the journey to Dong Van following a spectacular series of passes which wind through the mountains and valleys. En route you enjoy exceptional views of the rolling landscape and interesting flora and fauna. After that, we will have lunch at a local restaurant visiting the villages of the H’mong, Pho Bang, Pho Cao. You will have the chance to see the former palace of the H’mong King, Vuong Chinh Duc who was an ally of the French. You will arrive in Dong Van in late afternoon where you will have dinner at a local restaurant and spend the night in a hotel.
You’ll start the day off with breakfast and a visit to the Dong Van Market, where locals come from all the surrounding villages to purchase and trade for essentials they cannot produce themselves.

This day is likely to be your highlight of the tour, as we take you to one of the most incredible natural wonders in Northern Vietnam; Ban Gioc Waterfall. The drive here from Cao Bang is roughly two hours, and this breath-taking 300-metre wide cascade sits right on the border between China and Vietnam, amidst a beautiful mountainous landscape.

Today we leave Ha Giang behind and drive through mountain passes on our way to Ba Be National Park. Once in the park, you’ll have time to explore the many wonders located here, such as the lake itself, the caves of Puong Grott and finally the tiny Widow Island located on the lake.

Welcome to Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam’s bustling largest city! When you arrive, our friendly driver will be waiting to greet you at the airport and take you straight to your hotel for check-in. Your room will be ready for you from 2:00 PM onwards, so you can relax and settle in comfortably.

Today we journey down into the Mekong Delta, to explore the hinterland between the South China Sea and the Gulf of Thailand. Leaving Saigon by bus, a two-hour drive brings us to Binh Duc (My Tho), from where we begin cycling through a landscape of waterways, markets, orchards and riverside villages. Here, we can see local cottage industries making rice paper or coconut sweets as they have been for generations. The first 30 kilometres/18.6 miles of today's ride is on roads with moderate traffic and the remaining 20 kilometres/12.4 miles are on narrow pathways and routes that our support bus cannot follow.

Trang An Tourism Complex (located in the northern province of Ninh Binh) is one of the UNESCO’s World Heritage Committee lists. Located 60km from Ho Chi Minh Center,Cu Chiis now a popular spot for both Vietnamese & foreign tourists - the network of over 200km of tunnels became legendary when they played a vital role in the War. In their heyday, the tunnels were functioning underground cities including numerous trap doors, specially constructed living areas, storage facilities, weapons factories, field hospitals, command centers & kitchens.

Vietnam is a great combination for nature lovers and culture seekers. WithinVietnam Signature In 13 Days by Realistic Asia, tourists can experience the most compelling landscape as well as experience some of the cultural aspects of each destination, and start the tour from the classic and charming capital, Hanoi. Then head to Northern Vietnam for marvelous Sapa with interaction with local ethnic minority groups and sailing to the emerald waters in the most picturesque bay of Vietnam. Travel to the Central country, not to forget Hoi An - an enchanting lantern town, the star of the region.

Your Vietnam adventure begins with your arrival in Hanoi. Your private driver will meet you at the airport, holding a signboard with your name. He will escort you to your accommodation right in the heart of the city, with the fascinating Old Quarter at your fingertips. You can easily explore the city at your own pace or relax at the hotel after the flight.

Today your expert English-speaking local guide will give you an insight into the intricacies and traditions of Vietnamese food culture, including details on the ingredients and historical backgrounds of popular northern dishes. We eat as we go, trying seasonal fruits and sampling a tasty French-inspired snack from a street cart.

Have an early breakfast at the hotel and complete the check-out formalities. Take the limousine bus to get to Sapa, the travel time will take around 6 hours. Upon arrival to Sapa, you will be transferred to your accommodation. The rest of the day is free to explore this charming town right in the middle of the mountains.

itinerary_desc: Have breakfast at the hotel. Meet your guide around 9:30 am and start your 12 km trekking, visit Y Linh Ho and Lao Chai villages of the Hmong minority. On the way, enjoy the scenic beauty of the rice terraces and mountain peaks.

Enjoy the local breakfast at the homestay and get ready for trekking. We will leave around 9:30 a.m. and hike for about 8 km and visit 2 villages of the red Dzao and the Hmong minorities: Giang Ta Chai and Su Pan villages. Visit a beautiful waterfall and rattan bridge. Enjoy the beautiful landscapes of the valley and walk through the bamboo forest on the way to the main road, where the bus will pick you up and transfer you to Sapa. Spend some time exploring the town and leave for Hanoi around 15:00 by limousine bus.

Halong Bay is a natural wonder of the world and a UNESCO World Heritage site, and once you arrive there, you will understand why. Get ready to be amazed by the world's most breathtaking views, and have a relaxing time on the cruise, enjoying the exciting activities we have prepared for you.

The sun rises on Halong in the morning, and breakfast is served while the vessel cruises slowly back toward the port. Enjoy an early lunch before arriving at the port and disembarking. You will be transferred to the airport in Hanoi to take your flight to Hoi An.
Our English - speaking guide will meet you at the hotel around 8:00 am and take you for a cycle trip to the countryside and rivers around Hoi An.

Have breakfast at the hotel and get ready for the transfer from Hoi An to Hue by private car. You will drive through one of the most beautiful roads in the world - Hai Van Pass. You will be blown away by the stunning views of the mountains and the sea. Upon arrival in Hue check in the hotel and have free time to explore the surrounding area.
Hue City is the cultural, political, and economic center of the Thua Thien Hue province, and used to be an old imperial city of Vietnam under the Nguyen Dynasty.

Welcome to the Best of Vietnam Tour with Legend Travel Group! This 8-day itinerary takes you on a journey to explore the vibrant culture and breathtaking landscapes of Vietnam. From the charming streets of Hanoi to the stunning Halong Bay, the ancient town of Hoi An, and the bustling city of Ho Chi Minh, this tour offers a perfect mix of relaxation, adventure, and cultural immersion.

Welcome to Hanoi, Vietnam! On your first day, you can arrive in Hanoi at any time as the only activity scheduled is the airport pick up. A Legend Travel Group car driver will be waiting for you at the airport to take you to your hotel. Once you have checked in, the rest of the day is free for you to rest or explore the city and form your own first impressions of Vietnam. The airport transfer is included in the itinerary, so you don't have to worry about arranging transportation on your own. Stay overnight in Hanoi and get ready for an exciting adventure!

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, you will be picked up by our friendly guide to begin your exploration of Hanoi City. The first stop will be at Tran Quoc Pagoda, located on Golden Fish Island in West Lake. This pagoda is the oldest in Hanoi and was built in the 6th century. Admire the stunning architecture and learn about the history and culture of this important landmark.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, our mini-van/bus will pick you up between 8:30 am to 9:00 am to begin your journey to Halong City. During the 3.5-hour drive, you will have the opportunity to view the simple countryside and rice paddy life along the way. Once you arrive at the port, you will board your boat - an authentic Chinese Junk - and begin your amazing cruise through the stunning Halong Bay, a World Heritage Site. Lunch will be served on board and will consist of a selection of the freshest seafood.

Wake up early in the morning to witness a beautiful sunrise and breathe in the fresh ocean air. Enjoy breakfast served on the boat as we leisurely cruise through thousands of stunning and seemingly never-ending islands. This is an amazing opportunity to capture some breathtaking photographs of the scenery. We will also make a stop to visit a floating fishing village and hear legendary stories of the fishermen's daily life.

Enjoy a full-day excursion to Hoi An, a charming and historic trading center that was once known as “Faifo” to the earliest Western traders. It was also an important port for the Dutch, Portuguese, Italian, Chinese, Japanese, and other merchant vessels from the Far East.

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, you have the morning free to relax or indulge in some shopping in Hoi An. Later, you will be transferred to the airport for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City. Upon arrival, a friendly and professional driver will be waiting to pick you up and transfer you to your hotel for check-in.

After enjoying breakfast at the hotel, embark on a fascinating journey through the highlights of Ho Chi Minh City. Visit the Notre Dame Cathedral, a stunning example of neo-Romanesque architecture built by the French in the 19th century. Next, stop at the historic Central Post Office, designed by Gustave Eiffel and featuring a beautiful interior of intricate maps, intricate designs, and arched windows. Then, explore the Reunification Palace, the former presidential palace of South Vietnam and a symbol of the country's tumultuous past.

Discover the fascinating blend of history, culture and natural beauty with our Jewels of Hanoi, Sapa and Halong Bay tour. From the bustling streets of Hanoi to the charming hill tribe villages of Sapa and the stunning natural wonder of Halong Bay, this 7-day tour is packed with unforgettable experiences.

Welcome to Hanoi, Vietnam! On your first day, you can arrive in Hanoi at any time as the only activity scheduled is the airport pick up. A Legend Travel Group car driver will be waiting for you at the airport to take you to your hotel. Once you have checked in, the rest of the day is free for you to rest or explore the city and form your own first impressions of Vietnam. The airport transfer is included in the itinerary, so you don't have to worry about arranging transportation on your own. Stay overnight in Hanoi and get ready for an exciting adventure!
6:30-7:00 am: Our driver will pick you up from your hotel in Hanoi to begin the journey to Sapa. Along the way, we'll make a comfortable stop for a short break before continuing on to Lao Cai City.
7:30 am - Enjoy breakfast at the hotel.

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, you will be picked up by our friendly guide to begin your exploration of Hanoi City. The first stop will be at Tran Quoc Pagoda, located on Golden Fish Island in West Lake. This pagoda is the oldest in Hanoi and was built in the 6th century. Admire the stunning architecture and learn about the history and culture of this important landmark.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, our mini-van/bus will pick you up between 8:30 am to 9:00 am to begin your journey to Halong City. During the 3.5-hour drive, you will have the opportunity to view the simple countryside and rice paddy life along the way. Once you arrive at the port, you will board your boat - an authentic Chinese Junk - and begin your amazing cruise through the stunning Halong Bay, a World Heritage Site. Lunch will be served on board and will consist of a selection of the freshest seafood.

Wake up early in the morning to witness a beautiful sunrise and breathe in the fresh ocean air. Enjoy breakfast served on the boat as we leisurely cruise through thousands of stunning and seemingly never-ending islands. This is an amazing opportunity to capture some breathtaking photographs of the scenery. We will also make a stop to visit a floating fishing village and hear legendary stories of the fishermen's daily life.

This 7-day tour combines the history and excitement of Ho Chi Minh City, the coastal beauty of Nha Trang, and the refreshing charm of Dalat, creating a diverse and unforgettable southern Vietnam experience
On arrival at Tan San Nhat Airport, you are met and transferred to hotel.
The sightseeing tour acquaints us with the city’s some major sights.
Heading out of the town, we travel by roads to the Mekong Delta, Vietnam’s largest rice bowl.

The journey northwards begins as we depart Ho Chi Minh and pass through the many tea and coffee plantations to the hill station of Da Lat, sometimes known as the “City of Eternal Spring”. The drive is long but views are fantastic.
An impressive way to start our day is a walk around the town.
The fabulous sunny weather, turquoise water surrounding a string of islands and white sandy beach stretching the whole length of the city make Nha Trang one of Vietnam’s premier beach resorts.
Today we can get up from dawn to enjoy our last minute swimming on Nha Trang Beach.

Embark on an unforgettable 12-day journey through Vietnam's most captivating destinations with our 'Magical Vietnam' tour package. This comprehensive itinerary takes you from the ancient charm of Hanoi to the dynamic energy of Ho Chi Minh City, showcasing the country's rich cultural heritage and breathtaking natural wonders. Begin your adventure exploring the vibrant Mekong Delta's floating markets and lush orchards, then discover Ho Chi Minh City's historic landmarks. In Central Vietnam, experience the stunning Marble Mountains, navigate Hoi An's enchanting coconut jungles by basket boat, and stroll through the ancient town's lantern-lit streets. Marvel at the Golden Bridge's architectural wonder in Ba Na Hills before heading north to Ninh Binh, where you'll cycle through Hoa Lu's ancient capital and cruise through Trang An's spectacular limestone caves. The grand finale features an overnight luxury cruise amidst Ha Long Bay's iconic emerald waters, kayaking through hidden lagoons and dining under the stars. Carefully balanced to include cultural immersion, natural wonders, and leisure time, this tour offers private transfers, expert local guides, and authentic experiences - from Mekong Delta home-cooked meals to traditional lantern-making in Hoi An. Perfect for first-time visitors and returning travelers alike, our 'Magical Vietnam' package reveals the country's diverse beauty while ensuring comfort and seamless logistics throughout your journey

You'll be greeted at the Noi Bai airport and transferred to your hotel at the city centre. Time will be free for your refreshment.

In the morning drive to Mai Chau, we’ll leave the city behind and pass through the craggy, mountainous landscape.  On arrival in Pom Coong village, you’ll check in to the stilt-house home of a Thai ethnic minority family.  In the afternoon, you can cycle through the lovely villages in the Mai Chau valley letting your guide point out and explain the wonders along the way.  Afterwards, we return to Mai Chau for dinner and homestay in the stilt house with your friendly Thai hosts.

After breakfast with a view, you can wander around the houses to glimpse the daily life of local people.  They specialize in weaving brocade products and they’re happy to show visitors their skills.  The village is operated as a community cooperative organized by the people themselves – one of many reasons why Handspan is proud to bring visitors here.
After breakfast, we discover the secrets of making the excellent local Oolong tea.

8.00am - After breakfast, we say goodbye to Moc Chau and drive to Ky Son. This is an ancient Viet village of the most friendly local farmers who you will meet and interact with you through this two days trip. There are more than a hundred families living in this village, and most of them are farmers. Upon arrival around noon time, you will enjoy a local specialty ‘welcome drink’ before a short introduction to the house, kitchen and garden before joining the host for a home-cook lunch.

Wake up in the peaceful morning with fresh air, we will do a morning exercise or you will join the host for a 30 minute Taichi. We enjoy a breakfast before helping the host to prepare offerings for ancestor worship, a Vietnamese tradition to honor and show deep gratitude to their ancestor. We take an easy cycling on the quiet village roads to the nearby village of Duong Lam (about 5km) call in their famous pagodas and temples, experience daily life of local resident at their ancient houses.

After enjoying breakfast at the hotel, embark on a fascinating journey through the highlights of Ho Chi Minh City. Visit the Notre Dame Cathedral, a stunning example of neo-Romanesque architecture built by the French in the 19th century. Next, stop at the historic Central Post Office, designed by Gustave Eiffel and featuring a beautiful interior of intricate maps, intricate designs, and arched windows. Then, explore the Reunification Palace, the former presidential palace of South Vietnam and a symbol of the country's tumultuous past.

Morning depart for Cu Chi tunnel, the trip will take approximately one and a half hours bus driving. Upon arrival, before exploring the tunnels, you will have some short introduction followed by introductory video about how the tunnels were constructed and how the people survived in the harsh conditions of the war time. Then, spend your time to explore the remaining area and tunnel systems which included the special constructed living areas with kitchens, bedrooms side by side with other martial facilities like storage, weapons factories, field hospitals, and command centers helping whoever lives inside the tunnels meet their basic needs. Besides, there are also many hidden trap doors and dangerous traps within the maze-like tunnels for security purpose during the war. Afterward, special tea and cassava (guerilla’s food during the war) will be served.
Morning tour: 8:30 – 13:00

itinerary_accommodation: Hoi an Kim an  3⭐⭐⭐hotel / Rose Garden hotel 3⭐⭐⭐ / Golden holiday hotel 3⭐⭐⭐ or similar
itinerary_desc: This morning a flight brings you to thecoastal city of Danangin Vietnam’sCentral Region. You visit Cham Museum, an open-air collection of some of the finest sandstone carvings in the world,Cua Dai Beach, and theMarble Mountain, before you continue on to picturesque Hoi An, Vietnam's largest port. Known as Faifo to early western traders, it was one of Southeast Asia’s major international ports during the 17th, 18th and 19th centuries. Hoi An was inhabited by Japanese, Indian, Chinese and Portuguese traders; the city is remarkable for its collection of original Chinese temples and glorious homes built by wealthy merchants of earlier times. Stay overnight in Hoi An.

itinerary_accommodation: Hoi an Kim an  3⭐⭐⭐hotel / Rose Garden hotel 3⭐⭐⭐ / Golden holiday hotel 3⭐⭐⭐ or similar
itinerary_desc: Leave the hotel at8:00 morning. Drive toMy Son, a World Heritage site, 50 km southwest ofHoi An. Located in a lush valley, My Son was a capital and religious center of Cham people, now remaining with red brick towers and sanctuaries. My Son, considered to be in the same league as some of Southeast Asia's greatest archaeological sites, includingAngkor in Cambodia, Bagan in Myanmar,Ayutthaya in Thailand and Borobudur in Indonesia. These towers and sanctuaries were built from the 7 to 13 centuries. Return to Town for lunch by yourself around 1:00 pm.

itinerary_accommodation: Hoi an Kim an  3⭐⭐⭐hotel / Rose Garden hotel 3⭐⭐⭐ / Golden holiday hotel 3⭐⭐⭐ or similar
itinerary_desc: Enjoy a full-day excursion to Hoi An, a major trading center, once known as “Faifo” to the earliest Western traders. It was also an important port for the Dutch, Portuguese, Italian, Chinese, Japanese and other merchant vessels from the Far East. Visit atemple with partiallygilded statues in the center, a pagoda dedicated to sailors and fishermen and a chapel with origins in the 1700s that reflects the influences ofChinese and Japanese styles. Stop at theSa Huynh Museum, located near theJapanese Covered Bridge, which contains exhibitions from the earliest period of Hoi An’s history. Late this afternoon, take a boat trip on theThu Bon RivertoKim Bong Village on Cam Kim Islandto see the wood workers and shipbuilding families. Return to your haven on world-famous “Cua Dai Beach,” with the evening at your leisure. Overnight in Hoi An.

Experience Vietnam’s cultural and culinary treasures on this 7-day journey from Ho Chi Minh City to Hoi An. Cruise the Mekong Delta’s coconut-lined canals, sample street food by motorbike, and explore ancient pagodas. Fly north to Da Nang and Hoi An for hands-on cooking, countryside cycling, and a visit to Marble Mountains. With a perfect mix of heritage, cuisine, and local life, this tour is a feast for the senses.
Pick-up at the airport. Transfer to your hotel. Overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.

A trip to Mekong Delta offers a glimpse into the unique and distinct agrarian life of the vibrant southern Delta region. We will enjoy a cruise along the Mekong River to one of the Islands (located in the town of My Tho) where we will be entertained with traditional music while enjoying some tea sweetened with bee’s honey and seasonal fresh fruits.
After breakfast at the hotel, transfer to Tan Son Nhat airport to go to Hoi An. Upon arrival at Da Nang airport, pick up and transfer to Hoi An. Check in and relax. Overnight in Hoi An.

Discover Hoi An’s countryside and its local foods by bicycle. Local foods in Hoi An are known and enjoyed by the tourists once setting foot here. In Hoi An, these cuisines are very popular and sold everywhere in all streets. Moreover, these cuisines are considered as unique symbols for the culture and introduced to every tourist.

TheMarble Mountains(Vietnamese: Ngu Hanh Son; literally "five elements mountains") is a popular sightseeing location in Da Nang because of its alluring beauty. Stone steps carved into the mountain lead to a Buddhist Pagoda. There are plenty of exercises going up with many steps for a beautiful view from the top of the mountain. We will then visit the stone village where the skilled local sculptors create many marble products. Then, you will go to Am Phu Cave where there is a replica of “Heaven and Hell”, eerie underground tunnels while listening to the clapping of bats' wings in the cave.

Start your culinary adventure with a visit to the local market, where you will explore fresh ingredients and learn about traditional Vietnamese foods and flavors, preparing for your cooking class. Next, enjoy a unique basket boat ride through the famous Bay Mau Coconut Forest in Cam Thanh commune. Drift along tranquil waterways, surrounded by lush coconut groves, and take in the beauty of the landscape.

Discover the must-see highlights of Vietnam on this immersive 7-day tour. Begin in Hanoi, the capital city, and embark on an unforgettable overnight cruise through the breathtaking Ha Long Bay. Immerse yourself in the stunning landscapes and enjoy the tranquility of the bay. Fly to Ho Chi Minh City or Saigon, where you’ll delve into the historical significance of the Cu Chi tunnels and explore the vibrant city on a comprehensive city tour. Cruise through the picturesque Mekong Delta, witnessing the local way of life along the river. Conclude your journey in Ho Chi Minh City, with memories that will last a lifetime.

Upon arrival at Noi Bai Airport, after clearing all customs procedures, please proceed to exit gate and look for your driver who will be waiting at the lobby, holding the Wonderscape signboard with your name on it. You will be transferred to the hotel by private transportation. Check-in to the hotel and get over the jet lag. Check in time at 2PM

After breakfast at hotel, our guide and driver will pick you at the lobby. We leave Hanoi for Ninh Binh trip. About 10:30 AM arrive at Hoa Lu Ancient Capital. In 968, Dinh Bo Linh declared himself as the King. Since then Hoa Lu existed as the capital for the next 41 years (968 - 1009), of which 12 years was under the Dinh dynasty - King Dinh Tien Hoang, the country named Dai Co Viet, and 29 years later was under the Le dynasty - King Le Dai Hanh. In 1010, King Ly Thai To moved the capital from Hoa Lu to Thang Long – present day Hanoi. Hoa Lu became the old citadel. In Hoa Lu there are now two temples have been built on the ground of the old royal palace, one is dedicated to King Dinh Tien Hoang, the other is to King Le Dai Hanh. The visit offers a chance to know more about part of feudal dynasties and historical periods in Vietnamese history.

In the morning, after breakfast at the hotel, the cruise team will pick you up. Take the most scenic route to reach Ha Long Bay, taking you across the Red River Delta with emerald green rice paddies stretching for as far as the eyes can see. On arrival to Ha Long- the natural wonders of Southeast Asia, you will enjoy a cruise trip on the Bay and explore the limestone rocks and the karst grottoes.

Wake up early in the morning to witness the stunning sunrise and take in the fresh ocean air. Enjoy a delicious breakfast served on the boat while cruising leisurely through thousands of breath taking islands in Ha Long Bay. This is a great opportunity to capture some amazing photos of the picturesque scenery.

Leaving the hustle and bustle of Ho Chi Minh City and start your trip to depart for My Tho, the town lies on the left side of the Mekong River. Upon arrival, visit Vinh Trang pagoda which sated back to the late 19th century. Then boarding the sampan and cruising down the river around the four beautiful islands known as Dragon, Unicorn, Phoenix and Tortoise islands.

Morning depart for Cu Chi tunnel, the trip will take approximately one and a half hours bus driving. Upon arrival, before exploring the tunnels, you will have some short introduction followed by introductory video about how the tunnels were constructed and how the people survived in the harsh conditions of the war time. Then, spend your time to explore the remaining area and tunnel systems which included the special constructed living areas with kitchens, bedrooms side by side with other martial facilities like storage, weapons factories, field hospitals, and command centers helping whoever lives inside the tunnels meet their basic needs. Besides, there are also many hidden trap doors and dangerous traps within the maze-like tunnels for security purpose during the war. Afterward, special tea and cassava (guerilla’s food during the war) will be served.

Explore the highlights of Northern and Central Vietnam on this 8-day journey. Cruise among Ha Long Bay’s limestone karsts, uncover the charm of Ha Noi, and fly south to discover Hoi An’s ancient streets and culinary traditions. Visit the Golden Bridge at Ba Na Hills, sample local specialties on a countryside foodie tour, and enjoy free time to soak in Hoi An’s lantern-lit beauty.
Pick-up at Noi Bai International airport. Transfer to your hotel. Overnight in Ha Noi.

The wondrous Ha Long Bay is truly one of Vietnam’s most impressive sights. Heading out of town, we will embark by boat for an exploration of legendary Ha Long Bay. Ha Long Bay is home to some 3000 limestone islands that rise out of the clear emerald water. The limestone karsts formations are littered with beaches, grottoes and beautiful caves.
After breakfast, swimming and sunbathing. After lunch, return to Ha Noi. Overnight in Ha Noi.
After breakfast at the hotel, transfer to Noi Bai airport to go to Da Nang. Upon arrival at Da Nang airport, pick up and transfer to Hoi An. Check in and relax. Overnight in Hoi An.

Ba Na is one of the most interesting areas in the region as often one can feel the four distinct seasons within a single day: morning - spring, noon - summer, afternoon - autumn and evening - winter. You will have a chance to visit Golden Bridge which is a 150-meter long pedestrian bridge with two giant stone hands supporting the structure. It is designed to connect the cable car station with the gardens and to provide a scenic overlook and tourist attraction. We can enjoy the view of the beautiful landscape of nature comfortably and smoothly.

Discover Hoi An’s countryside and its local foods by bicycle. Local foods in Hoi An are known and enjoyed by the tourists once setting foot here. In Hoi An, these cuisines are very popular and sold everywhere in all streets. Moreover, these cuisines are considered as unique symbols for the culture and introduced to every tourist.
Free time all day to explore Hoi An on your own or take optional tour with Hoi An Express. Overnight in Hoi An.

Experience the best of Vietnam in 10 days with this tour package from Legend Travel Group. From the bustling city of Hanoi to the tranquil Mai Chau Valley, the stunning Halong Bay, charming Hoi An, and the vibrant Ho Chi Minh City, this tour will take you on a journey through the rich culture, history, and natural beauty of Vietnam. With comfortable accommodations, delicious meals, and expert guides, you will be immersed in the local way of life and create memories that will last a lifetime.

Welcome to Hanoi, Vietnam! On your first day, you can arrive in Hanoi at any time as the only activity scheduled is the airport pick up. A Legend Travel Group car driver will be waiting for you at the airport to take you to your hotel. Once you have checked in, the rest of the day is free for you to rest or explore the city and form your own first impressions of Vietnam.

After enjoying breakfast at the hotel, the itinerary begins with a departure from Hanoi at 8:30 am, embarking on a scenic drive along one of the most beautiful country roads to the tranquil Bakhan Village via Hoa Binh City. Along the way, travelers will get a chance to enjoy the picturesque natural beauty of the countryside.

09:00: Start your day with an invigorating trek on the East Mountain route, where you'll be surrounded by the natural beauty of Mai Chau. This trek is suitable for all fitness levels and offers stunning views of the valley.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, our mini-van/bus will pick you up between 8:30 am to 9:00 am to begin your journey to Halong City. During the 3.5-hour drive, you will have the opportunity to view the simple countryside and rice paddy life along the way. Once you arrive at the port, you will board your private boat - an authentic Chinese Junk - and begin your amazing cruise through the stunning Halong Bay, a World Heritage Site. Lunch will be served on board and will consist of a selection of the freshest seafood.

Wake up early in the morning to witness a beautiful sunrise and breathe in the fresh ocean air. Enjoy breakfast served on the boat as we leisurely cruise through thousands of stunning and seemingly never-ending islands. This is an amazing opportunity to capture some breathtaking photographs of the scenery. We will also make a stop to visit a floating fishing village and hear legendary stories of the fishermen's daily life.

Enjoy a full-day excursion to Hoi An, a charming and historic trading center that was once known as “Faifo” to the earliest Western traders. It was also an important port for the Dutch, Portuguese, Italian, Chinese, Japanese, and other merchant vessels from the Far East.

After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the hotel, you have the morning free to relax or indulge in some shopping in Hoi An. Later, you will be transferred to the airport for a flight to Ho Chi Minh City. Upon arrival, a friendly and professional driver will be waiting to pick you up and transfer you to your hotel for check-in.

After enjoying breakfast at the hotel, embark on a fascinating journey through the highlights of Ho Chi Minh City. Visit the Notre Dame Cathedral, a stunning example of neo-Romanesque architecture built by the French in the 19th century. Next, stop at the historic Central Post Office, designed by Gustave Eiffel and featuring a beautiful interior of intricate maps, intricate designs, and arched windows. Then, explore the Reunification Palace, the former presidential palace of South Vietnam and a symbol of the country's tumultuous past.

After enjoying breakfast at your hotel, your tour guide will pick you up at 8:00 am to start your journey to My Tho, the capital city of Tien Giang Province. This picturesque city is located on the Mekong River, about 75 kilometers southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, and is known for its lush orchards and rice fields that produce grains for the entire country.
Guaranteed to depart! This tour is guaranteed to depart, so even if you're the only passenger confirmed, your tour will still go ahead as planned!

Diversity terrains make theLuxury Vietnam Adventure Journeyan attractive tour for travellers all around the world. Heading to the outskirts of Hanoi, interacting with local people, and participating in the regional activities in Ba Vi mountainous landscape. Breakthrough Son Doong Cave - the biggest mysterious cave in the world will be unforgettable memories once in your lifetime. Camping, climbing, and experiencing the natural ecosystem that nearly untouched Son Doong cave. Afterwards, you’ll have an opportunity to immerse yourself in the largest remaining area of lowland tropical rainforest in the country- Cat Tien National Park. All of this will create the most fascinating memories of your life!

Your Vietnam adventure begins with your arrival inHanoi. Your private driver and English-speaking guide will meet you at the airport, holding a signboard with your name. They will escort you to your accommodation right in the heart of the city, with the fascinating Old Quarter at your fingertips. You can easily explore the city at your own pace or relax at the hotel after the flight.
Enjoy a hearty breakfast at the hotel then our experienced English-speaking guide escorts you on the trip toBa Vi, a countryside located on the outskirt of Hanoi.

itinerary_accommodation: Phong Nha Lake House Resort or similar
itinerary_desc: Relish the remaining moment inHanoibefore your private driver escorts you to the airport to take the flight toDong Hoi. When you arrive at Dong Hoi airport, your driver will pick you up and transfer you to your accommodation. The rest of the time is free at leisure.

From 07:30 - 08:00 The bus will pick you up at your hotel in Phong Nha and continue to the Tan Hoa office. At the office, visitors will listen to the safety briefing, including the itinerary, sign the release form, pack for the trek and receive safety equipment.

The second day continues full of cave adventures and explores three beautiful caves of the Tu Lan Cave System; Ken Cave, Tu Lan Cave and Kim Cave. After breakfast, the group will first explore and swim into Ken Cave, which is one of the most beautiful caves in the Tu Lan Cave System.

itinerary_accommodation: Phong Nha Lake House Resort or similar
itinerary_desc: Starting the third day, a steep hill is waiting to be conquered and it will lead you to the entrance of Song Oxalis Cave – a cave with the most unique and rare cave coral calcite formations. After contemplating the beauty of Song Oxalis Cave, trek downhill back to the campsite, and enjoy lunch, before crossing To Mo Valley and entering Hung Ton Cave beside the waterfall.

itinerary_accommodation: Phong Nha Lake House Resort or similar
itinerary_desc: In the early morning, guests can enjoy watching the sunrise over the beautiful Tan Hoa green fields, or cycle to explore the Tan Hoa Village. Then enjoy breakfast prepared by the chef from the tour at Tu Lan Lodge.

itinerary_accommodation: The Myst Dong Khoi or similar
itinerary_desc: Have breakfast after at the hotel, your private driver takes you to Dong Hoi Airport. Take a flight to Ho Chi Minh City. Formerly known as Saigon, Ho Chi Minh City is the biggest economic, vibrant and dynamic city, a rapidly developing metropolis. Despite bustling and developing city, Ho Chi Minh City still retains specific iconic such as the Opera House and Norte Dame Cathedral, which are mostly constructed in France colonial architecture. Have free time to explore this beautiful city on your own.

Our driver will pick you up from your hotel and set off for the 4-hour drive north to Nam Cat Tien National Park.  Park was established in 1998 and is actually comprised of two separate areas, Nam Cat Tien and Cat Loc, which are linked by the Dong Nai River. Nam Cat Tien is well-known as a tropical rainforest with high biodiversity and a variety of fauna and flora.
